titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Julius Hemphill Papers MSS.542
titlestmt.author: Item-level description created by Marty Ehrlich. File-level inventory created by Brian Fairley.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-11 08:16:54 -0500.

change.item: Record updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2020 accretion and materials cleaned due to mold damage

physdesc.extent: in 5 record cartons, 3 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, 10 oversize flat boxes, and 3 small flat boxes

did.abstract: Julius Hemphill was a jazz composer and saxophone player who helped found the World Saxophone Quartet. He was a founder of the World Saxophone Quartet, the Julius Hemphill Quartet, and the Julius Hemphill Sextet. Hemphill's compositions and arrangements are noted for their combination of jazz, blues, and big-band sound. This collection consists of materials created and collected by Julius Hemphill from the mid-1960s to 1995 documenting Hemphill's career as a jazz composer and saxophonist. Materials in this collection include personal correspondence, original writings, ephemera, and manuscript music in various formats and stages of completion, including composition notebooks, scores, and parts to compositions. The manuscript music consists of compositions by Hemphill in his hand, compositions prepared by professional copyists, and arrangements and re-compositions of works by Hemphill of other composers. The collection also includes audio and video recordings of Hemphill's concert recordings, rehearsals, and interviews of Hemphill from radio broadcasts.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials created and collected by Julius Hemphill from the mid-1960s to 1995 documenting Hemphill's career as a jazz composer and saxophonist. Materials in this collection include personal correspondence, original writings, ephemera, and manuscript music in various formats and stages of completion, including composition notebooks, scores, and parts to compositions. The manuscript music consists of compositions by Hemphill in his hand, compositions prepared by professional copyists, and arrangements and re-compositions of works by Hemphill of other composers. The collection also includes audio and video recordings of Hemphill's concert recordings and rehearsals on audiocassette, reel-to-reel tapes, optical discs, VHS cassettes, and other formats. The audio recordings also include interviews of Hemphill from radio broadcasts.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Julius Hemphill was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Ursula Oppens in June and July 2018, and February 2020; the accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2018.086, 2018.112, and 2020.028.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Julius Hemphill Papers; MSS 542; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact fales.library@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Julius Hemphill (1938-1995) was a jazz composer and saxophone player who helped found the World Saxophone Quartet. Hemphill was born in Fort Worth, Texas, and served in the United States Army for several years beginning in 1964. He began playing the clarinet, studying under John Carter, before learning saxophone. Hemphill later moved to St. Louis, Missouri and co-founded the Black Artists' Group (BAG) arts collective. He moved to New York City in the 1970s and became an active member of the city's jazz community, performing, recording, and teaching other musicians. He was a founder of the World Saxophone Quartet, the Julius Hemphill Quartet, and the Julius Hemphill Sextet. Hemphill's compositions and arrangements are noted for their combination of jazz, blues, and big-band sound.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Prior to the collection's transfer to the archives, individual items were described by Marty Ehrlich. At the time of accessioning, an archivist rehoused the collection in archival boxes, described the materials at the collection-level, and imported a modified version of the item-level inventory. Born-digital items were identified, physically separated, and inventoried but have not yet been forensically imaged, analyzed, or described. The February 2020 accretion to this collection has been intellectually added to this collections as Series II. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.
In the spring of 2020, materials in Boxes 13, 21, and 22 with water damage and evidence of mold were cleaned by a vendor, returned to the archives, and intellectually integrated into the collection.

phystech.head: Born-Digital Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact Fales Library and Special Collections, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596] with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Guitar and cello part to a fourteen-measure composition, not in Hemphill's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nineteen-page holograph score, ruled by hand, orchestrated for a jazz big band (five woodwinds, three trumpets, French horn, trombone, tuba, cello, bass, and percussion).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts to a work for saxophone quartet, orchestrated using woodwind doubles (soprano saxophone, flute, alto flute, bass clarinet).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Five-page score photocopied from Sightation Notebook for a work for clarinet, French horn, saxophone, bass, and drums. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph concert score. Sixty-three-measure big-band arrangement of a Jack DeJohnette composition dedicated to pianist Ahmad Jamal. The folder also includes a holograph score for backgrounds during the solo section from measure 63, with detailed notes to the copyist in red ink. The melody of the original DeJohnette composition is not notated in the score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Score in holograph for a work in two voices in treble and bass clef. There is a treble melody line, first designated for flute, but then suggested for soprano saxophone 8vb. The bass clef part is mostly single notes, though double stops may indicate a cello. There are also professionally copied soprano saxophone and bass parts, as well as parts in holograph for trumpet and guitar. The piece has an eight-bar intro, a twenty-bar A section, repeated, and an eight-bar bridge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet (two soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone), based on material from "The Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil of a piece for trumpet, two tenor saxophones, and bass clarinet. Score is in five lines, with meticulous phrase markings. Pages 4 and 5 (of 10 indicated) are missing. This piece was written for "Anchorman," a theatrical work in two acts by Paul Carter Harrison. Folder also includes a shorter score, marked "Act I," orchestrated for soprano saxophone, trumpet, tenor saxophone, and bass clarinet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for a saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). Composition is part of a suite entitled "Wind/Rhythms" written for World Saxophone Quartet's collaboration with Max Roach's M'Boom. This work is a slow chorale. See "Wind/Rhythms" for full score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transposed holograph score in pencil of a piece for saxophone sextet (soprano, two altos, two tenors, baritone). Twenty-one measures. Hemphill wrote this work as a concert piece for the Julius Hemphill Saxophone Sextet; folder includes set of manuscript parts not in composer's hand and professionally copied parts use for the Sextet folio published by Subito Music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of "Fourth Blues: Uttered Flute" (a title in a decorative compartment) from Foran Notebook. An improvised flute solo, this piece was included on the album Blue Boyé (1977) under the title "Antecedent."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts to a piece for saxophone sextet (two sopranos, alto, two tenors, baritone) originally written for "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil for an up-tempo piece orchestrated for soprano saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums. It is eighteen measures long with a written tag; the form is AABA + tag. Score is annotated with phone numbers and addresses for different individuals. Folder also includes professionally copied parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet (soprano, two alto, two tenor, and baritone). See "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land" for additional score and parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for a work for alto saxophone and cello. Folder also includes a score in holograph for alto saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums, with detailed notes to the copyist, as well as a holograph alto saxophone part and a photocopy of a trumpet part from Trumpet Notebook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full set of parts, professionally copied, on paper and transparency (paper vellum). Folder includes photocopies of parts (some originals in "Aggregated Parts").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil as well as several photocopies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil for saxophone sextet (soprano, two altos, two tenors, baritone), titled "Backgrounds Band Theme." This piece was written for Julius Hemphill Sextet and was included in "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera." Parts were improvised during the tenor saxophone solo based on Jimmy Heath's "CTA" chord changes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Score with professionally-copied parts for a piece for flute, bass, and drums. Vellum and light-sensitive paper. Includes note for copyist that a guitar part should be made. The piece is eighteen measures long, with intro in 7/4 and main section in 2/2. Hemphill's notes indicate that a portion of this composition is used in the eighth movement of the "Drunk on God" suite. That movement is titled "Mailika" on the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988); it is titled "Maliaka: Drum / Woman" in Hemphill's score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four parts in holograph for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone). Included on the album Point of No Return (1977) as "Bajou Scetches" (and attributed to Hamiet Bluiett).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for a piece for big band (flute, alto saxophone / clarinet, alto/tenor saxophone, tenor/alto saxophone / flute, baritone saxophone / clarinet, bass clarinet / tenor saxophone / piccolo, French horn, trombone, tuba, cello, bass, and two percussion parts).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Parts in holograph for two guitars and bass (the instrumentation of Hemphill's JAH band), with chord symbols in a different hand. The parts are from a movement in the suite "Drunk on God," which appears on the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). The movement is titled "Cosmic Country Boy" on the recording. See "Drunk on God" for parts and score, with title sometimes as "From Out of Nowhere: The Big Drum Speaks."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score and parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Sightation Notebook of a work for clarinet, trumpet, alto saxophone, bass, and drums. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two-page holograph score for a piece with a soprano or alto vocal line and unorchestrated accompaniment. In pencil and black ink with annotations in red ink; photocopies include further annotations. Several manuscript notebooks include parts for this piece for reeds/woodwinds (soprano and alto saxophone, clarinet, flute), brass (trumpet, French horn, trombone), cello, and bass. The piece is the "Opening Song" from music written for the theater piece "A Bitter Glory."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of parts in holograph for trumpet and tenor saxophone. Identified as page 2; page 1 not in folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bass and guitar parts (each one page) in holograph of a twenty-one measure piece. Musik Hug Notebook has a score that includes a partial part for saxophone (included in folder as a photocopy).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil, with annotations in red ink, of a big-band arrangement dated 1980. There are further additions in Hemphill's hand, with background parts and harmonizations corresponding to the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). The folder also includes a saxophone quartet arrangement (soprano, soprano/alto, bass clarinet / tenor saxophone, alto clarinet / baritone saxophone), as well as professionally copied parts; the first page (of two) for the bass clarinet / tenor saxophone part is missing. Folder includes a piano score in holograph for "Bordertown," with the the annotation "Good Boye Music ASCAP" on each page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for big-band arrangement, reflecting some changes of instrumentation between 1980 and 1988 versions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper vellum parts and photocopies for the 1980 big-band arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder includes Hemphill's alto saxophone part in holograph, as well as a photocopy from Schirmer's Notebook of the melody line for a duet for two alto saxophones. The holograph alto saxophone part includes some harmony notes to the melody found in Schirmer's Notebook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of incomplete score from Schirmer's Notebook for an enlarged big band ensemble (piccolo, flute, clarinet, alto, tenor and baritone saxophones, three trumpets, trombones, cello, bass, and percussion.) Score includes sketch for fourteen-measure intro, followed by twenty measures of a soprano saxophone part with some chord symbols.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a holograph score from Foran Notebook, for a work for flute, soprano saxophone, and alto saxophone, recorded through an overdub process on the album Blue Boyé (1977). The piece is titled "C.M.E." on the album and "Seventh (Roots)" in the notebook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Big band arrangement in holograph score in pencil, with annotations in red ink, as performed in 1980. There is an additional page in holograph with material that was used for the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). Folder includes several photocopies of the big band score. This piece has been variously titled "C," "C (Those Blues)," and "C/Saw."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for the big band arrangement, on paper vellum and paper.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Viola part in holograph, with title written in black felt-tip pen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of score, possibly in Hemphill's hand, with written instructions in Hemphill's hand, for flute, baritone saxophone, cello, and drums. The piece is forty-six measures long and is based on the main motive of Buddy Miles's composition "Changes." The piece may be incomplete, as there is a letter "D" following the fermata in measure 46.

did.unittitle: Children's Song, The - Saxophone quartet version

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Alto clarinet part, probably in Hamiett Bluiett's hand, which transposes the clarinet part from a work orchestrated for two flutes, clarinet, and tenor saxophone; a photocopy of the holograph score for from Foran Notebook is included here. Folder also includes a trombone part by a professional copyist on paper vellum, indicating performances by a different ensemble.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One-page holograph score for saxophone sextet (three altos, two tenors, baritone) and voice (dancers onstage), in which Hemphill harmonizes the opening melody of his saxophone quartet of the same title. The folder also includes professionally copied parts for soprano, two altos, tenor, and baritone saxophone. (A second tenor part may be missing.) Folder includes photocopy of holograph score, as well as a different orchestration for alto saxophone, trumpet, tenor saxophone, trombone, baritone saxophone, and bass. This was the final movement of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." See "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land" for score and parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook and several sets of photocopied parts, also in composer's hand, of a piece for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One-page holograph score for an unfinished piece for saxophone quartet (two altos, tenor, baritone). In pencil and black ink with annotations in red ink. Nine-bar intro, eight-bar A section, and an eight-bar B section consisting only of baritone saxophone melody.

did.unittitle: Cole, Bill: Compositions arranged by Hemphill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score of arrangements for an octet (two woodwinds, trumpet, tuba, cello, bass, and two percussionists) of seven compositions by Bill Cole. In pencil and black ink with further annotations in red and blue ink, fifteen pages in total. Piece titles: "To Sow Is To Reap," "Live with Humble Man /Spirit," "Tormenter," "Beat Drum / Man Man," "One Man's Hatred / Destiny," "Don't Go to Bed With Your Roof Afire," "Man Woman Snake Dead." Folder includes envelope in which scores were mailed from Cole to Hemphill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Parts in holograph of a piece for saxophone quartet (two altos, tenor, baritone). The piece is a 34-measure slow chorale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for a piece for saxophone quartet (two sopranos, tenor, baritone). Ballad in 3/4 time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two-page holograph score in black ink for a piece orchestrated for flute, trumpet, and cello. Folder includes holograph parts for cello and trumpet. The piece is twelve measures long, with a four-bar vamp at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook of a piece entitled "Fifth Blues," orchestrated for flute, soprano saxophone, and alto saxophone. This piece appears on the album Blue Boyé (1977) with the title "Countryside."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One-page holograph score, eleven measures long, along with photocopy of score that includes additional tempo marking in composer's hand, of a composition for string quartet (violin, viola, cello, double bass). Instruction for "cymball roll" suggests the piece originally included percussion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cello part in holograph.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four parts in holograph of piece for saxophone quartet (two soprano, tenor, and baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Score in holograph of piece for three instruments, likely alto saxophone, cello, and an unknown third instrument. The score is fifteen measures long, with three unidentified parts; lowest line indicates "arco" at times. There are two parts in Hemphill's hand for alto saxophone and cello, though they do not correspond precisely to the lower two staves in the full score.

did.unittitle: Dimples: The Fat Lady on Parade

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of score in composer's hand from Sightation Notebook for clarinet, soprano saxophone, trumpet, bass, and drums. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of score in composer's hand from Foran Notebook, recorded as an overdub composition on the album Blue Boyé (1977). In the notebook, it is titled "Fifth Blues." Score consists of several twelve-tone rows with transpositions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Kawaida Notebook, entitled "Original Dogon A.D," for alto saxophone, trumpet, vibraphone, and drums. Various parts for alto saxophone, trumpet, cello, bass, tuba, bass clarinet, and guitar, reflecting different group arrangements. Some parts are in holograph, others professionally copied, and others in different hands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Score in holograph for big-band arrangement of "Dogon A.D.", orchestrated for five saxophones, trumpet, French horn, trombone, tuba, vibraphone, bass, and drums. There is a complete set of professionally copied parts on paper vellum and paper for this twelve-piece arrangement, as well as a part in holograph for guitar, with annotation in composer's hand. See large-scale work "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera" for an arrangement with added strings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cello part in holograph for a seventy-measure piece.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Score in holograph for one unidentified instrument, apparently torn from manuscript book. Tempo marking is "Very slow" and the piece is divided into "Part I" and "Part II."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of parts in composer's hand for two flutes, soprano and tenor saxophone. Holograph full score appears in Foran Notebook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various parts for clarinet, alto saxophone, trumpet, tuba, bass, drums, and guitar, some in holograph, others professionally copied. There are two incomplete scores, both indicating a quintet arrangement, one in holograph with lines for tuba, bass, and drums, the other a photocopy from Sightation Notebook for clarinet, alto saxophone, and trumpet. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of trumpet part in composer's hand. Sixteen-measure melody.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil, with annotations in composer's hand in red ink, for big-band (five saxophones, five trumpets, four trombones, guitar, keyboard, bass, and drums). Arrangement of a composition by Jack DeJohnette. Folder includes second score in holograph for two background sections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of page from Foran Notebook, not in composer's hand. Part for cello with instructions for improvisation. (May not be Hemphill composition.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for alto saxophone, tenor saxophone, and bass. From a sequence of pieces in Schirmer's Notebook for similar instrumentation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil and blue ink for saxophone sextet (soprano, two altos, two tenors, and baritone). Score bears the titles "Cornered" and "Fat Man." The first page of the score has been cut in half. Folder includes holograph parts with annotations by members of the sextet, including instructions for improvisation on Hemphill's first alto part, as well as photocopies of professionally copied parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for alto saxophone, tenor saxophone, and bass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone, cello, and drums. The page also bears the title "One Groove," and the second page of the score features the composition "Sixteen."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums. Professionally copied parts for alto saxophone, bass, and drums, with note in composer's hand indicating some parts to be performed ad lib.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone sextet, three alto, two tenor, and baritone sax. Holograph parts. Some parts bear alternative title, "Shorty."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, two tenor, and baritone). Composition is part of a suite entitled "Wind/Rhythms" written for World Saxophone Quartet's collaboration with Max Roach's M'Boom. Percussion sections indicated in parts. See "Wind/Rhythms" for full score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (two soprano saxophones, alto clarinet, and bass clarinet). Parts reflect specific instrumentation used by the World Saxophone Quartet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for two flutes, alto flute, and bass clarinet. Each part has the number "11" at top of page, indicating order in a series of works. Composition is part of a suite entitled "Wind/Rhythms" written for World Saxophone Quartet's collaboration with Max Roach's M'Boom. See "Wind/Rhythms" for full score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph short score; holograph parts for trumpet, tenor saxophone, and cello. There is also an alto-saxophone transposition of the trumpet part in Marty Ehrlich's hand. This piece is included on the album Flat Out Jump Suite (1980) under the title "Body."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Musik Hug Notebook, as well as holograph parts for trumpet, guitar, and bass, which differ from the score. Score fragment with indication "After the original Float," indicating later extension of the work. This piece was arranged and titled "Floating" for the "Drunk on God" suite.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil for saxophone sextet (three alto, two tenor, and baritone). Includes three sets of parts: photocopies of holograph parts except first alto saxophone part (see Aggregated Parts for originals), manuscript parts not in composer's hand, and photocopies of professionally copied parts used for the published sextet collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone sextet (soprano, two alto, two tenor, and baritone). Includes manuscript parts likely in the hand of a sextet member, and photocopies of professionally copied parts used for the published sextet collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fragmentary holograph score in pencil. Of the four staves, one contains a 24-measure melody for flute. "Tenor" is written at the top of the page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four holograph scores representing different arrangements and stages of composition. One-page holograph score with melody for alto saxophone in pencil and chords in red ink. Thirteen-page concert score for big band (five saxophones with flute doubling, trumpet, flugelhorn, trombone and baritone horn, and rhythm section). There is also a four-page extension of this big-band arrangement, with flute parts and annotations in pencil and red ink. Two-page score (transposed) for alto saxophone, trumpet, tenor saxophone, French horn, guitar, bass, and percussion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Complete set of professionally copied parts for big band (1980 version) on paper vellum. Additional professionally copied parts for two trumpets, trombone, and two guitars. There are also two guitar parts, one in holograph, one professionally copied, as well as an alto saxophone part with additional chordal writing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook, for alto saxophone, trumpet, bass, and drums. See "One Two Three Four" for the other movements from this four-part suite. Folder includes various parts for alto saxophone, trumpet, guitar, cello, and bass, some in holograph, several of these photocopied from parts containing multiple pieces (see "Aggregated Parts").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (alto, two tenor, and baritone) in blue and black ink. Four parts in manuscript, likely in Marty Ehrlich's hand, with additional annotations in various hands. One part includes chord notations in Hemphill's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts in black ink for saxophone quartet (two altos, tenor, and baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph short score from Musik Hug Notebook. The version of the piece on the album Raw Materials and Residuals (1977) differs in structure from this score. Holograph part for tenor saxophone, which resembles material in "A Bitter Glory" Notebooks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (solo alto, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone). Holograph parts for quartet version for alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone. This piece was arranged for saxophone sextet (solo alto, soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone) for the large-scale work "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera." Folder contains professionally copied parts for the sextet version. See "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera" for additional score and parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score (transposing) for saxophone sextet (three alto, two tenor, and baritone). Folder includes manuscript parts likely in the hand of a sextet member, and photocopies of professionally copied parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for trumpet, tenor saxophone, cello, and percussion, including notes for copyist. Photocopies of professionally copied parts (originals in "Aggregated Parts").

did.unittitle: Hard Blues, The - Score and small group parts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score for alto saxophone, trumpet, and cello/bass from Chiaroscuro Notebook. Holograph part for cello (with instructions for drums), as well as professionally copied parts for trumpet and alto saxophone. Folder includes photocopy of holograph score for big-band arrangement (two soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophones, two trumpets, trombone, tuba, vibraphone, bass, and drums), which premiered in 1980. Also includes one-page original holograph score with additional background parts. Folder includes parts for saxophone sextet arrangement, based on big-band parts. See also "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

did.unittitle: Hard Blues, The - Big band parts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Complete set of professionally copied parts in paper vellum and paper, as well as photocopies, for big-band arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two photocopies of holograph part for cello, one with annotations in blue ink, the other with different annotations in black felt pen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score (two pages) and professionally copied parts for flute, flugelhorn, marimba, and cello. Parts include annotations in composer's hand in red ink. Score includes instructions for percussionist. Marimba part includes note "with Joanne," possibly referring to dancer Joanne Robinson-Hill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph transposing score for saxophone sextet (soprano, two alto, two tenor, and baritone). One original part in holograph for alto I, and photocopies of remaining holograph parts. Folder includes professionally copied parts for the published sextet collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone). Folder includes photocopies of holograph parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three related scores, composed for saxophone sextet and intended, though apparently not used, for "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin/The Promised Land" and "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera." Holograph score for saxophone sextet (three altos, two tenors, and baritone), three pages long, with sections "Part I" and "Part II." A photocopy of this score has further annotations in Hemphill's hand in red ink. An additional manuscript page of "Part II" in pencil, not in Hemphill's hand, indicates expanded instrumentation, as in "Long Tongues."

did.unittitle: Homeboy Tootin' at the Dog Star

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook, where it is titled "Eighth (Flute)." Included on the album Blue Boyé (1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook, where it is titled "Second." Composed for soprano and alto saxophones and included on the album Blue Boyé (1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score, two pages, for flute (See "Aggregated Parts" for original). Two other pieces, "Trills" and "Reflective," appear on the same manuscript pages.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score with the subtitle "Sketch II," composed for large ensemble, including winds, strings, saxophone sextet, and rhythm section, similar to the instrumentation used for "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera," which contains a movement entitled "Sketch II." Folder includes complete set of manuscript parts in black ink, not in Hemphill's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score and professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone), in pencil and red ink. Folder includes a number of parts in various hands, as well as a set of professionally copied parts for a version orchestrated for two alto saxophones, tenor saxophone, two trumpets, trombone, French horn, violin, viola, and two unidentified instruments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for saxophone quartet on mixed woodwinds (alto and tenor saxophone, bass clarinet, and baritone saxophone). Parts include names of World Saxophone Quartet members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph transposing score for alto and baritone saxophones, guitar, cello, and drums. Folder includes a lead sheet in a different key and with some differences in melody from the score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). Composition is part of a suite entitled "Wind/Rhythms" written for World Saxophone Quartet's collaboration with Max Roach's M'Boom. The suite was apparently not performed at that concert. See "Wind/Rhythms" for full score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also appears under titles "K C Line," "Bop Scene: KC Line," or "Gates of Kansas City." Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook for solo alto saxophone, bearing the title "Sixth Blues." Appears as sixth track on the album Blue Boyé (1977). Melody is a ten-bar blues form. Folder includes photocopy of holograph part with chord changes and melody in bass clef, as well as a holograph part with chord changes. There is also a holograph trumpet part and trumpet parts likely in Baikida Carroll's hand, photocopied from Trumpet Notebook and Bass Notebook. Appears as a movement in the large-scale works "Drunk on God" (for big band) and "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil and red ink for 12-piece big-band composition (five reeds, four brass, with three-piece rhythm section). Folder includes professionally copied parts on paper vellum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone sextet (soprano, two alto, two tenor, and baritone). Six-page score includes four printed pages of the poem "Collected Poem for Blind Lemon Jefferson" by K. Curtis Lyle, which was used for a recording in 1971. Score includes stage directions for musicians (possibly related to compositional process for "Long Tongues").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). Second holograph score with instructions for arranging the quartet version for big band, including additional sections. Folder includes professionally copied parts for big band. A note from the copyist indicates that a full score of the big band arrangement was not made.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arrangement for orchestra by Scott Munson, commissioned by the Richmond Symphony. Folder includes computer-printed full score and parts, as well as a photocopy part for the saxophone soloist with chord changes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arrangement by Hemphill for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone) of song by Marvin Gaye and Edward Townsend. Holograph score and photocopy of holograph with additions and corrections in Hemphill's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for soprano saxophone, flute, and bass. Fifteen-measure composition, with saxophone part apparently at concert pitch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts in black and red ink for saxophone quartet playing other woodwinds (flute, alto flute, tenor saxophone, and bass clarinet).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for cello (original is in "Aggregated Parts").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). Folder includes holograph part for baritone saxophone, though no other parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arrangement of Billy Strayhorn composition by Hemphill for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone). Four-page holograph score, the latter two pages labeled "extra sheets" with solo sections. Folder includes notes by Hemphill, perhaps contemporaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Musik Hug Notebook for saxophone and guitar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone sextet (three alto, two tenor, and baritone) with instructions for drums. This piece was used in various stages of "Long Tongues" and possibly as part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score for saxophone, guitar, trumpet, and cello/bass, notated in short score. Suite of five movements, only four of which are present: "II: Antecedent: Love/Understanding"; "III. Inquiry/Findings"; "IV. Tightenin'"; "V. Oracle." Pages numbered up to fifteen, though pages one, two, and ten are apparently missing. Folder includes photocopy of cello part for "Tightenin'" (original is in Aggregated Parts).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arrangement of Mel London composition by Hemphill for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone). Holograph concert score and professionally copied parts on paper and paper vellum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph part for cello of 26-measure composition. No other score or parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for string quartet (two violin, viola, cello) and photocopy of holograph with yellow sticky-note annotation. Adaptation/arrangement of three compositions by Charles Mingus: "Nostalgia in Times Square"; "Alice's Wonderland"; "Better Get Hit In Yo' Soul" (stylized by Hemphill as "Betta Gititin Yo Sole"). Folder also includes computer print-out of full score with annotations in red ink by Marty Ehrlich, as proofs for published edition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of complete set of professionally copied parts for string quartet, apparently for premiere performances by Kronos Quartet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printouts of published full score for saxophone sextet (two soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone) with guitar, as published by Subito Music. Folder includes various parts for small-group version for alto saxophone, trumpet, baritone saxophone, cello and guitar, most in holograph, but the trumpet part is a photocopy of a manuscript not in Hemphill's hand from Trumpet Notebook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score (transposing) for saxophone sextet (three alto, two tenor, and baritone). Photocopies of professionally copied parts. Published in the Saxophone Sextet collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two pages of holograph score. One page has composition in short score with indications for trumpet, guitar and bass. The other page is possibly an alto saxophone part, with chord symbols. Likely a piece for quintet of saxophone, trumpet, guitar, bass and drums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of fragmentary holograph score from Chiaroscuro Notebook. An eleven-measure melody for flute with part of a second line.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone sextet (two soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone) with bass and drums. Dedication or homage to Ornette Coleman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (three tenor and baritone). Page bears copyright symbol and date of 1981. Folder include professionally copied parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for saxophone quartet on mixed woodwinds (flute, clarinet, and two soprano saxophones). The parts bear annotations likely by members of the World Saxophone Quartet, including a note on the clarinet part to transpose for alto clarinet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook for soprano and alto saxophones and flute. In the notebook it bears the title "Third" and was the third track on the album Blue Boyé (1977), where it is titled "OK Rubberband."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for piano and string quartet. Commissioned by Ursula Oppens and the Arditti String Quartet and premiered in February 1992. Folder includes photocopy of holograph score and photocopy of full score published by Subito.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for Hemphill's arrangement of Jack DeJohnette composition for big band (five saxophones, five trumpets, four trombones, guitar, keyboard, bass, and drums). Folder includes professionally copied alto saxophone part, apparently from DeJohnette's small group version, with annotations by Hemphill likely in preparation for big-band arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for flute, alto and tenor saxophones, piano, bass, and drums. Ten-measure-long composition, dedicated to saxophonist John Stubblefield. Folder includes a manuscript copy of the score in an unknown hand, without measure numbers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook of suite of four pieces for saxophone, trumpet, and percussion. The titles of the four pieces are stylized "#One"; "#Two"; "#Three" and "#Four." Folder includes photocopies of trumpet parts for the first three movements from Sightation Notebook. Of the four movements, only "Four" seems to have been performed as a free-standing piece. See "Four" for additional score and parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone) and photocopy of holograph score in Musik Hug Notebook of version for saxophone, two guitars, and bass. Folder includes holograph parts for cello, bass, guitar, tenor saxophone, and baritone saxophone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for twelve-piece big band, and holograph parts for version for saxophone quartet using mixed woodwinds (two alto/soprano saxophone, tenor saxophone / bass clarinet, alto clarinet / baritone saxophone). Folder includes holograph parts for alto saxophone and trumpet, perhaps for an arrangement for quartet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for solo flute. Folder includes photocopy of untitled melody for flute from preceding pages in notebook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet (two soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone). This piece was composed for "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land" and performed separately in concert by the Julius Hemphill Sextet. See "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin" for holograph score and parts.

did.unittitle: Orientation of Sweet Willie Rollbar, The

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score for flute, trumpet, and drums, from Kawaida Notebook, with title "Rollbar," beginning at "Sec. VI." Likely related to Hemphill's score for the film "The Orientation of Sweet Willie Rollbar" (1972).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet (three alto, two tenor, and baritone). This piece was also incorporated into large-scale works. See "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land" and "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera" for score and parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for two alto saxophones, guitar, cello, and drums. Titled "Out, The Regular" on the album Diminutive Mysteries (1992).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied cello part, possibly from 1972 recording session for Dogon A.D. Photocopy of holograph cello part, on page including "Rites" and part of "The Hard Blues." See "Aggregated Parts" for original.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score in pencil and red pen for solo piano. Composed for pianist Ursula Oppens. Personal note from Hemphill to Oppens on obverse of first page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph parts for tenor saxophone and trumpet (original is in "Aggregated Parts"). Composition recorded as quintet with saxophone, guitar, cello, drums, and percussion on the Wildflower sessions in 1976. Also recorded as a duo with saxophone and cello on the album Live In New York (1978).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for alto saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums. Folder includes holograph guitar part. This composition was incorporated into the "Drunk on God" suite for big band, with the title "Motion as the (Terrible) Language of the Future." See "Drunk on God" for big-band score version.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for cello, bass, and guitar, and photocopy of trumpet part from Trumpet Notebook. Folder also contains holograph parts for baritone saxophone and tenor saxophone, from the version for saxophone quartet recorded on the album World Saxophone Quartet (1980). There are several photocopies of a single holograph page, which includes a single line with riffs or chord voicings, perhaps a "background" part for the saxophone quartet version.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph part for alto saxophone and photocopies of holograph parts for cello/bass and French horn. This piece was recorded as a trio for alto saxophone, cello, and percussion on Raw Materials and Residuals (1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for soprano saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums. Folder includes professionally copied parts for saxophone, bass, and drums. Instructions for guitar on the score were likely added later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score for soprano saxophone and bass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone), and photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook. This piece was also used in "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera" in arrangement for saxophone sextet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for cello (see "Aggregated Parts" for original).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of manuscript part in unknown hand for solo flute (See "Aggregated Parts" for original). The part containing this piece also includes the compositions "Trills" and "Hummer."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for soprano saxophone, trumpet, tenor saxophone, French horn, guitar, bass, and percussion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). This piece was also used in "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land," arranged for saxophone sextet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for soprano saxophone, trumpet, French horn, baritone saxophone, two guitars, bass, and drums. Holograph score for big-band arrangement (five saxophones, two trumpets, two French horns, two trombones, two guitars, bass, and drums). Big-band arrangement likely made for a recording session for Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988) though not included on album. Photocopy of holograph score from Kawaida Notebook for alto saxophone, trumpet, guitar, and bass, with title "Original Rites." Folder includes complete set of professionally copied parts for big-band arrangement, as well as a variety of other parts, holograph, photocopy, and in unknown hands, for trumpet, guitar, cello, bass, drums, and string instruments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score for soprano saxophone, trumpet, marimba, and cello. This work apparently part of a suite including "Volunteered Blues" and "Hand Packed."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph part for bass, containing thirty measures of chord progressions. Sheet includes a separate composition, "S464Z."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone). Folder includes professionally copied parts with annotations in Hemphill's hand in red ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for two alto saxophones, included on the album Buster Bee (1978). Folder also includes holograph parts for small-ensemble version for alto saxophone, trumpet, cello, guitar, and bass, and professionally copied parts for guitar and bass. See "Lady S" for big-band arrangement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for bass, containing sixteen measures of chord progressions. Sheet includes a separate composition, "River Waltz."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Chiaroscuro Notebook for trumpet and alto saxophone, with empty staves labeled for piano, bass, and drums. Folder includes professionally copied parts for trumpet and alto saxophone, and a photocopy of a part for cello (original is in "Aggregated Parts.")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several photocopies of holograph score for flute, cello, and drums, with title "Savanah [sic] Suite." Folder includes photocopy of cello part (original in "Aggregated Parts") with title "S. Suite, Motional III."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for trio (soprano or alto saxophone, bass or cello, and drums). Folder includes photocopies of holograph parts for soprano saxophone, trumpet, and cello (originals in "Aggregated Parts").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for soprano and baritone saxophones, guitar, cello, and drums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone. Additional page includes chord chart not in Hemphill's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Kawaida Notebook for flute, trumpet, vibraphone, and drums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for bass (see "Aggregated Parts" for original). The part on which this piece is found contains three other compositions that appear on the album Raw Materials and Residuals (1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for tenor saxophone, flugelhorn, cello, and marimba. This piece may have originally appeared as part of "Sketch #3," one of the movements of "Ralph Ellison's Long Tongue." See "Ralph Ellison's Long Tongue." Folder includes photocopy of holograph score for same instrumentation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score for alto saxophone, cello, and bass. See "Fifteen" for the original. This piece appears on the same score under the titles "Fifteen" and "One Groove."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for alto saxophone, guitar, and bass and holograph score for soprano saxophone, trumpet, and tenor saxophone. Folder also includes several professionally copied parts—apparently the work of different copyists—for alto saxophone, bass, and drums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for cello (original in "Aggregated Parts"). Largely a graphic score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for alto saxophone, trumpet, cello, and percussion. Professionally copied parts for alto saxophone, trumpet, and cello, with part for guitar by a different copyist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph part for cello. There is an untitled composition, also for cello, on the same sheet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for flute, flugelhorn, and cello. Folder includes photocopies of holograph parts (originals in "Aggregated Parts") for cello, flugelhorn, and bass, as well as photocopy of holograph flute part.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for soprano and baritone saxophones, guitar, cello, and drums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of printed parts for alto saxophone and baritone saxopone, with additional part for baritone in unknown hand, based on material from the final part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land" (see for additional scores and parts).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for flute, alto flute, and bass clarinet of a piece composed for the World Saxophone Quartet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for two alto saxophones and tenor saxophone from a piece composed for the World Saxophone Quartet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy from Musik Hug Notebook of holograph score for guitar and saxophone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for trumpet, alto saxophone, piano, bass, and drums. Professionally copied parts for alto saxophone and trumpet. Folder includes holograph parts for tenor and baritone saxophone, which, with the trumpet and alto saxophone parts, were used for a version for saxophone quartet(soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). There is a photocopy of a holograph short score with the saxophone quartet instrumentation. Folder includes holograph part for guitar, photocopy of holograph part for cello, and a set of professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet arrangement. "Sweet D" was incorporated into the large-scale piece "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for two flutes or oboe, two clarinets, two violins, viola, cello, bass, and voice, including lyrics. Folder includes set of holograph parts, complete except for a change in instrumentation (four cellos instead of two violin, viola, and cello). Also a complete set, in same instrumentation as score, copied in an unknown hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for saxophone quartet (three tenor and baritone).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for cello (original in "Aggregated Parts"), with fingerings likely in Abdul Wadud's hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone) of arrangement by Hemphill of Billy Strayhorn composition. The parts include instructions for arranging the piece for saxophone sextet. The piece also appears in the score for "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score and parts for saxophone sextet using mixed woodwinds (three flutes, alto saxophone, and two tenor saxophones).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for alto saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums. Folder includes two sets of professionally copied parts. The first set, on paper and paper vellum, is for alto saxophone, bass, and drums, with notes to the copyist in Hemphill's hand. The second set of parts includes a guitar part in addition to alto saxophone, bass, and drums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet (two soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone). The second tenor part is photocopied. See "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: III" for additional scores and parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for cello (original in "Aggregated Parts").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). Folder includes complete set of professionally copied parts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score for solo soprano saxophone (see "Aggregated Parts" for original). Appears on score with compositions "Hummer" and "Reflective."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for four flutes, soprano saxophone, and tenor saxophone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for alto and baritone saxophones, guitar, cello, and drums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for soprano saxophone, two guitars, bass, drums, and percussion. Likely written for the JAH Band.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph score from Musik Hug Notebook for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone). Although the score is untitled, professionally copied parts, also in folder, bear the title "Void."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score and professionally copied parts for alto saxophone, trumpet, cello, and percussion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder includes several versions of this piece for different instrumentation. Holograph score and professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (two alto, tenor, and baritone). Holograph score, with two photocopies, for big band (alto saxophone, four flutes, flugelhorn, French horn, baritone horn, tuba, vibraphone, and bass). Folder includes professionally copied parts for bass and drums, a holograph piano part with instructions for performance, and parts for flute, two violins, cello, and soprano saxophone, in an unknown hand. See "Plan B" for orchestral arrangement by Christopher Bankey.

did.unittitle: What I Know Now - Big Band Parts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for big band (alto saxophone, flour flutes, flugelhorn, French horn, baritone horn, tuba, vibraphone, and bass).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of holograph part for unidentified B-flat instrument (original in "Aggregated Parts.")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for saxophone quartet (switching among soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone, and flute, alto flute, and bass clarinet) with notes for percussion. Suite with five movements: "Fixation," "Flair," "Ji-Ji Tune," "Another Feeling," and "Stick." See "Stick" and "Ji-Ji Tune" for additional parts. Composition written for collaboration with Max Roach and M'Boom. Folder includes two pages with instructions for performance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for trumpet, alto saxophone, guitar, and bass, some titled "Wood Boogie."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph parts for trumpet, tenor saxophone, and cello. Photocopy of holograph score for three unidentified instruments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Parts for multiple compositions, with more than one composition per sheet, in a variety of hands though many in holograph.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Parts and scores, many in holograph, with unidentified or fragmentary compositions. Outside of folder includes notes in Marty Ehrlich's hand.

did.unittitle: Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: I. The Cabin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for "The Cabin," the first part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "Cabin Opener"; "Harry"; "Liza - Tearful Farewell"; "George"; "Slave Dance"; "Chloe"; "Tom"; "Men's Chase / Haley's Dance"; "Tom's Goodbye"; "Boat Music"; "Slave's Walk"; "Lucy"; "St. Clair Family"; "Eva and Tom"; "Dixie Dance"; "Death of Eva"; "Auction"; "Tom's Whipping"; "Ghosts"; "Retrograde"; "Fanfare for Lincoln."

did.unittitle: Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: II. Eliza on the Ice

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for "Eliza on the Ice," the second part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "Knee Play"; "Eliza on the Ice"; "Aint' I a Woman"; "Elevator Music"; "Betsy"; "Prayer Music"; "End of Betsy"; "Fanfare for Maya"; "Soft Shoe"; "Maya"; "Prayer Music."

did.unittitle: Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: III. The Promised Land

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for "The Promised Land," the third part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "At Dr. King's Table"; "Step Dance"; "Dixie Dance"; "Football"; "Ascension"; "Crossformation"; "Opening (Hymn)"; "Three-Step."

did.unittitle: Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: IV. The Last Supper

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score for "The Last Supper," the fourth part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "Arthur"; "Trans"; "Men's Trio"; "Ringmere"; "Ringmere Canon"; "Four Saints"; "Spiritual Chairs"; "Lenny"; "The Children's Song."

did.unittitle: Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land - Assorted Parts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various parts for saxophone sextet for the different movements of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land. Many in pencil, in different hands. Some parts include cut-out photocopies of scores, assembled into performance order. Several parts identify the name of the musician in the original performance.

did.unittitle: Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land - Photocopy scores

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various photocopies of scores for "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

did.unittitle: Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land - Part Notebooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score of "Drunk on God" suite for big band (five saxophones, two trumpets, two French horns, two trombones, two guitars, drums, and bass), written for the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). The movements (titled differently on the recording) are "Nago: Testament"; "Maliaka: Drum/Woman"; "Pigskin" or "Motion as the Lang"; "Float"; "Bob Scene: KC Line"; "Anchorman"; "From Out of Nowhere: The Big Drum Speaks." Several movements exist as independent compositions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Set of professionally copied parts for several movements of the "Drunk on God" suite ("Nago: Testament," "Maliaka: Drum/Woman," "Motion as the Lang"/"Pigskin," and "Float"). Includes annotations in various hands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Set of professionally copied parts for several movements of the "Drunk on God" suite ("Anchorman," "The Big Drum Speaks," and "Bob Scene - KC Line."). Includes annotations in various hands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph score with multiple movements from the theatrical work "Ralph Ellison's Long Tongue." Instrumentation includes alto and tenor saxophone, trumpet, French horn, and cello. Individual movements are "Sketch 1," "Sketch 2," Sketch 3," "Sketch 4," and "Sir Preacher." Folder includes holograph parts for two additional movements: "Carnival Barker," for which there is an alto saxophone part, and "Orator," for which there are parts for trumpet, cello, and soprano saxophone. These parts include settings of text based on the novel by Ralph Ellison, Invisible Man (1952).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professionally copied parts for seven instrumentalists playing various woodwinds. The parts are identified by the names of the original musicians, with annotations in various hands and photocopied parts attached with tape.

did.unittitle: Water Music for Woodwinds - Materials for Edition

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of the professionally copied parts for seven woodwind players, with further annotations in red ink. Folder includes two printouts of computer-engraved full score, with annotations in red pencil and ink by Marty Ehrlich, dated January 2003. Additional pages contain photocopies of hand-written notes on performance sequence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript scores, likely in Christopher Bankey's hand, for an arrangement for orchestra of several Hemphill compositions. Includes several pages of short score, with notes on instrumentation, as well as two pagse of full score with measure numbers and notes for insertion. The individual movements of "Plan B" are "Border Town," "What I Know Now," and "Dogon A.D."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printout of computer-engraved full score for "Plan B," an arrangement for orchestra by Christopher Bankey of three Hemphill compositions, "Border Town," "What I Know Now," and "Dogon A.D." The score is printed as two pages per 11"x17" sheet, fifty-three sheets in total.

did.unittitle: Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - Holograph and Conductor's Score

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holograph full score, in pencil and blue, black, and red ink. Conductor's score (oversize), cleanly copied in pencil, with annotations in black and red ink by unknown hand. Individual sections include "Georgia Blue," "Band Theme," "Danse A La Midi," "A Prayer Type Line," "Sketch I," "Sketch II," "Sketch III," "Sketch IV," "Overture," "Bop Scene: KC Line," "Otis' Groove," "Mask Dance," "R and B," "Dogon A.D.," "For Andrew," "Soulo."
